14#ifndef DNS_DYNDB_H
15#define DNS_DYNDB_H
16
17#include <stdbool.h>
18
19#include <isc/types.h>
20
21#include <dns/types.h>
22
23ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
24
25/*!
26 * \brief
27 * Context for initializing a dyndb module.
28 *
29 * This structure passes global server data to which a dyndb
30 * module will need access -- the server memory context, hash
31 * initializer, log context, etc. The structure doesn't persist
32 * beyond configuring the dyndb module. The module's register function
33 * should attach to all reference-counted variables and its destroy
34 * function should detach from them.
35 */
36struct dns_dyndbctx {
37 unsigned int magic;
38 const void *hashinit;
39 isc_mem_t *mctx;
40 isc_log_t *lctx;
41 dns_view_t *view;
42 dns_zonemgr_t *zmgr;
43 isc_task_t *task;
44 isc_timermgr_t *timermgr;
45 bool *refvar;
46};
47
48#define DNS_DYNDBCTX_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('D', 'd', 'b', 'c')
49#define DNS_DYNDBCTX_VALID(d) ISC_MAGIC_VALID(d, DNS_DYNDBCTX_MAGIC)
50
51/*
52 * API version
53 *
54 * When the API changes, increment DNS_DYNDB_VERSION. If the
55 * change is backward-compatible (e.g., adding a new function call
56 * but not changing or removing an old one), increment DNS_DYNDB_AGE;
57 * if not, set DNS_DYNDB_AGE to 0.
58 */
59#ifndef DNS_DYNDB_VERSION
60#define DNS_DYNDB_VERSION 1
61#define DNS_DYNDB_AGE 0
62#endif
63
64typedef isc_result_t dns_dyndb_register_t(isc_mem_t *mctx,
65 const char *name,
66 const char *parameters,
67 const char *file,
68 unsigned long line,
69 const dns_dyndbctx_t *dctx,
70 void **instp);
71/*%
72 * Called when registering a new driver instance. 'name' must be unique.
73 * 'parameters' contains the driver configuration text. 'dctx' is the
74 * initialization context set up in dns_dyndb_createctx().
75 *
76 * '*instp' will be set to the driver instance handle if the function
77 * is successful.
78 *
79 * Returns:
80 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
81 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
82 *\li Other errors are possible
83 */
84
85typedef void dns_dyndb_destroy_t(void **instp);
86/*%
87 * Destroy a driver instance. Dereference any reference-counted
88 * variables passed in 'dctx' and 'inst' in the register function.
89 *
90 * \c *instp must be set to \c NULL by the function before it returns.
91 */
92
93typedef int dns_dyndb_version_t(unsigned int *flags);
94/*%
95 * Return the API version number a dyndb module was compiled with.
96 *
97 * If the returned version number is no greater than than
98 * DNS_DYNDB_VERSION, and no less than DNS_DYNDB_VERSION - DNS_DYNDB_AGE,
99 * then the module is API-compatible with named.
100 *
101 * 'flags' is currently unused and may be NULL, but could be used in
102 * the future to pass back driver capabilities or other information.
103 */
104
105isc_result_t
106dns_dyndb_load(const char *libname, const char *name, const char *parameters,
107 const char *file, unsigned long line, isc_mem_t *mctx,
108 const dns_dyndbctx_t *dctx);
109/*%
110 * Load a dyndb module.
111 *
112 * This loads a dyndb module using dlopen() or equivalent, calls its register
113 * function (see dns_dyndb_register_t above), and if successful, adds
114 * the instance handle to a list of dyndb instances so it can be cleaned
115 * up later.
116 *
117 * 'file' and 'line' can be used to indicate the name of the file and
118 * the line number from which the parameters were taken, so that logged
119 * error messages, if any, will display the correct locations.
120 *
121 * Returns:
122 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
123 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
124 *\li Other errors are possible
125 */
126
127void
128dns_dyndb_cleanup(bool exiting);
129/*%
130 * Shut down and destroy all running dyndb modules.
131 *
132 * 'exiting' indicates whether the server is shutting down,
133 * as opposed to merely being reconfigured.
134 */
135
136isc_result_t
137dns_dyndb_createctx(isc_mem_t *mctx, const void *hashinit, isc_log_t *lctx,
138 dns_view_t *view, dns_zonemgr_t *zmgr, isc_task_t *task,
139 isc_timermgr_t *tmgr, dns_dyndbctx_t **dctxp);
140/*%
141 * Create a dyndb initialization context structure, with
142 * pointers to structures in the server that the dyndb module will
143 * need to access (view, zone manager, memory context, hash initializer,
144 * etc). This structure is expected to last only until all dyndb
145 * modules have been loaded and initialized; after that it will be
146 * destroyed with dns_dyndb_destroyctx().
147 *
148 * Returns:
149 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
150 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
151 *\li Other errors are possible
152 */
153
154void
155dns_dyndb_destroyctx(dns_dyndbctx_t **dctxp);
156/*%
157 * Destroys a dyndb initialization context structure; all
158 * reference-counted members are detached and the structure is freed.
159 */
160
161ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
162
163#endif /* DNS_DYNDB_H */
164
